summary: The 'Uplifting First-Time Homebuyers Act of 2025' amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Specifically, it increases the limitation on qualified first-time homebuyer distributions from $10,000 to $50,000. The amendment applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024. The bill was introduced in the Senate on September 18, 2025, and referred to the Committee on Finance.
